svg.text: Explainable AI-Guided Environmental Health Discovery Pipeline

g.text: First XAI-guided environmental health discovery validated by traditional epidemiology
Framework Innovation: Bridging Machine Learning and Environmental Epidemiology
Unbiased Discovery: XAI identifies patterns without prior assumptions about sex differences
Mechanistic Hypothesis: Biological interpretations guide traditional epidemiological testing
Rigorous Validation: DLNM provides gold-standard environmental health confirmation
Generalizable Framework: Pipeline applicable to other environmental health questions
XAI Models: Random Forest + Gradient Boosting ensemble with permutation importance testing
DLNM Setup: Natural spline cross-basis functions, 0-21 day lags, sex-stratified analysis
Sample Sizes: 1,283-4,957 participants across 6 validated biomarker analyses
Figure 2. XAI-DLNM Methodological Framework for Climate-Health Discovery.
Four-stage pipeline: (1) XAI exploration identifies climate-demographic interactions through unbiased machine learning,
(2) Hypothesis generation formulates testable biological mechanisms, (3) DLNM validation provides rigorous epidemiological
confirmation, and (4) Validated discoveries inform future research directions. Feedback loop enables iterative improvement.
